data.title: Transportation Engineering
data.meta_description: Namma Metro - Free download as PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. The Namma Metro system in Bangalore, India consists of two operational lines - the Purple Line and Green Line. The Purple Line runs 18.1 km between Baiyappanahalli and Mysore Road, while the Green Line runs east-west for a total length of 42.3 km serving 41 stations. Phase 1 of construction included these two lines and was completed in 2017, while Phase 2 aims to further expand the network by 2022 to provide connectivity to important tech hubs. The system is owned and operated by the Bengaluru Metro Rail Corporation and had an average daily ridership of 315,000 passengers as of 2022.
